question: Which of the following is known as Varna-ashrama-dharma society?
explanation: The Later Vedic society was divided into the four varnas: Brahmanas, Rajanyas or Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras. The institution of ashrama or the different stages of life was also established. The varna and Later Vedic society together came to be known as Varna-ashrama-dharma society.
